page.title: 12*THE ABBATOIR,A BUSINESS.*
page.content: At lunchtime on June 13th we went to the abattoir to talk to the boss Mr McMurchie.We found that he has traded in Haswell for 15 years.He has extended his premises and built a butchers shop.It was owned by the Coop.His premises are bothered by vandals.There were two attempted burglaries this year. His supplies come from Northumbria, Alnwick and Stockton marts.He supplies 48 retail outlets with meat.The largest belongs to Colin Lawson in Ushaw Moor. The smallest is Mr Gott's in Thornley.He has 150 regular customers buying for the home freezer every week, but most meat goes to retailers.People come from all over north east England.Mr McMurchie says that this is because he keeps old fashioned methods of quality butchering.Nearly all of his staff travel from other villages.
